page.title: 08RECREATION CENTRE,HIGHWORTH
page.content: Throughout the 1939_45 war a fund, called "The Welcome Home Fund "was collected to build an ex_service man's club in Highworth.After the war various items of land given to the fund,were sold to provide money,which was also raised by dances,carnivals etc.A grant of money and a loan were provided by Wiltshire County Council, and the D.O.E. agreed 25% of the total cost.The land for the centre was eventually sold to the Recreation Centre Committee for one shilling, provided that building commenced within one year.Although funds were still insufficient,pegging out was done and load of gravel delivered,to satisfy this condition.This was in July 1966 and on November 26th the foundation stone was laid.The club room was opened on December 3rd 1967 and the swimming pool in 1968.
